column3: utACK b73628d5a8e259a7f1fee5c4a245b463990f05a5. It survived 2 full Travis runs, and fixed the same issue occurring in #11167.

If this is what I think it is, that PRs that were built by travis and cached before #11210 was merged have a `~/.bitcoin` in their cache, it can also be solved by wiping the Travis caches.\n\nEdit: had to wipe the entire travis cache to test this - the Travis interface made it impossible to select individual PRs beyond 11111 or so. So I wiped all the cache and started a new build for the branche
@laanwj does Travis cache data only from builds which pass all tests?
@laanwj In that case this should never be an issue again right, because there should be no way for the directory to ever be cached, so we can close this

I hope so! I'm not sure this is actually the issue, but it seemed likely. I do not understand where a .bitcoin directory would come from otherwise. We still might merge this though for symmetry, I don't know.
I don't think this was solved, I started #11289 a few times and it's still failing. Reopening.
Going to merge this, so we gain some air to breathe. But I can't see how this dir was created at that point.
Great! I think this is good for a temporary workaround.\n\nThere's no chance that `travis.yml` will be executed on user's account, otherwise this would be terribly dangerous.
